intro: Teinostachyum schisostachyoides, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed screw-pine, is a flowering plant native to the Indo-Pacific region. It belongs to the family Pandanaceae and is characterized by its slender, often branching stems and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in spikes, and it has strap-shaped leaves that are often aromatic. It is commonly found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline or brackish environments. This species is sometimes used in traditional medicine and for ornamental purposes due to its unique appearance.
